FuncDef: The bridge-domain range command creates a temporary BD range and displays the BD range view. The bridge-domain range command creates a temporary BD range and displays the BD range view. By default, no temporary BD range is created. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start BD ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the end BD ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo: When replacing a TRILL network with a VXLAN network, you need to configure multiple VXLAN-related commands in each BD. Even if you bind a BD profile to a BD to simplify the configuration, the configuration is difficult when a large number of BDs are required. In addition, manual configuration or maintenance by the network administrator is labor-intensive and cannot ensure configuration consistency. To improve maintenance efficiency and simplify configuration, run the bridge-domain range command to create a temporary BD range and bind a BD profile to the BD range. After the binding is successful, the configuration is delivered to all BDs in the BD range in batches.
